body.p: To have the RichTextBoxSupportsXHTML display XHTML formatted text, set its Xhtml property to the string of XHTML code you wish to display.

The RichTextBoxSupportsXHTML is meant to add functionality to the RichTextBox by allowing those who wish to display formatted text to write in elegant well-formed XHTML, instead of cumbersome RTF. It is not intended to display entire web pages. That being said, this control only supports a limited number of XHTML tags which pertain to text formatting. Its Xhtml property will ignore portions of the input string that contain images, graphics, and other complex elements. If you wish to display such items in a text box, you should copy them from a web page and paste them in a normal RichTextBox control. The following is a list of supported tags, attributes, and style properties:

p.code: h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 h6

ul.p: a (does not make links, but does color and underline)
ul li (limited support only: see Bullets below)

body.p: All other tags will have no effect on the text, however their attributes and descendent elements will be evaluated. Comments will not be evaluated.

Unordered lists are partially supported by this control. They cannot be nested. It is highly recommended that each item in the list be enclosed within a p tag. However, the li tag is not necessary for proper bullet formatting. It will simply add extra space between each line.
In the body and font elements, foreground color may be set using either hexidecimal (#RRGGBB) or one of 16 predefined, case-sensitive color names.
